issue.title: [C++] Include "null" values (perhaps with an option to toggle on/off) in hash kernel actions
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-4787](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4787). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
Null is a meaningful value in the context of analytics. We should have the option of considering it distinctly in e.g. `ValueCounts`

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-4787?focusedCommentId=16853410) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
FYI `[~fsaintjacques]` `[~pitrou]` – it is important to be able to compute analytics for values occurring when hash keys are null, rather than dropping them
